messages: 8bf2df6768574f8883223885ee867e86 (20:22): I guess your problem is with pam_ldap
8bf2df6768574f8883223885ee867e86 (20:22): I have no clue how to do that
8bf2df6768574f8883223885ee867e86 (20:24): you COULD just make your own script that runs the smbpasswd command
8bf2df6768574f8883223885ee867e86 (20:24): that would take all of 1 minute to create
8bf2df6768574f8883223885ee867e86 (20:25): so when you actually execute smbpass or passwd it add/updates/removes the user IF he/she/it exists
8bf2df6768574f8883223885ee867e86 (20:25): sorry if I'm of no help
3a9bd330de19b0936f52fccd162ba11d (20:26): probably not to be possible to do that without ldap
8bf2df6768574f8883223885ee867e86 (20:26): that will DEFINITLY help you out

8bf2df6768574f8883223885ee867e86 (20:26): pam_smbpass is a PAM module that can be used on conforming systems to keep the smbpasswd (Samba password) database in sync with the UNIX password file. PAM is an API supported under some UNIX operating systems, such as Solaris, HPUX, and Linux, that provides a generic interface to authentication mechanisms.

8bf2df6768574f8883223885ee867e86 (20:26): This module authenticates a local smbpasswd user database. If you require support for authenticating against a remote SMB server, or if you are concerned about the presence of SUID root binaries on your system, it is recommended that you use pam_winbind instead.
3a9bd330de19b0936f52fccd162ba11d (20:26): Tas0: there's problem with plaintext pass
3a9bd330de19b0936f52fccd162ba11d (20:27): Tas0: pam_smbpass has problem with creating user ..when not exist in smbpasswd it crashed
3a9bd330de19b0936f52fccd162ba11d (20:27): Tas0: mistake..forget the sentence with plaintext
